key_facts: A record-breaking heatwave is affecting over 130 million people in the U.S.
Temperatures have exceeded 100°F (38°C) in multiple U.S. regions.
Regions affected include the Pacific Northwest, Mid-Atlantic, and Northeast.
Cities like Eugene, Portland, and Baltimore are under excessive heat warnings.
Some areas are expected to reach heat index values of 110°F (43°C).
The National Weather Service has extended heat advisories.
The public is advised to stay hydrated and avoid sun exposure.
Wildfire risks have increased due to extreme heat.
Major wildfires are burning in Butte County and near Yosemite National Park.
Southern Texas is bracing for heavy rainfall from Hurricane Beryl’s remnants.
Experts attribute the extreme heat to heat domes and high humidity.
The Midwest has experienced heat domes since June.
